item.title: Parsing S3 Inventory CSV output in Python
item.description: S3 Inventory is a great way to access a large number of keys in an S3 Bucket. Its output is easily parsed by AWS Athena, enabling queries across the key names (e.g. find all keys ending with .png) However, sometimes you just need to list all of the keys mentioned in the S3 Inventory output (e.g. populating an SQS queue with every keyname mentioned in an inventory output). The following code is an example of doing such task in Python:
